Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the Azure SQL Database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of service tier, compute size, and storage requirements. Plan for high availability and disaster recovery.
Secure necessary approvals and authorizations for the project, including budget allocation and compliance checks.
Create the Azure SQL Database instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Select the appropriate service tier and region.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the Azure SQL Database from specific IP addresses or Azure services.
Enable security features such as Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), Advanced Threat Protection, and auditing. Configure access control using Azure Active Directory authentication.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Backup and Restore Policies
Tasks.Task Description: Configure automated backups and define restore policies to ensure data protection and recovery options.
Configure performance tuning options such as indexing, query optimization, and monitoring tools to ensure optimal database performance.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and SQL Insights to track database health, performance, and security.
Perform thorough testing of the database, including connectivity, query execution, and failover scenarios.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure SQL Database setup.
Verify that the database setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to maintain compliance.
